Digital regulation: Thierry Breton faces sanctions as US-EU dispute intensifies
subhead: Former EU commissioner Thierry Breton, who led tech sector regulation efforts, is now barred from having a US visa. The Trump administration condemned the EU's online content moderation measures as 'censorship.'

Semiconductors: The tiny chips powering the global economy
subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (2/5). As the fourth most traded product globally, electronic components have become essential to most industries. The sector, which is expected to reach nearly $1 trillion by 2026, has now become as powerful and strategic as the oil industry.

title: French biathlon team races ahead on the unpredictable road to the Olympics
subhead: Torn between strong performances and a tense atmosphere, the French biathletes faced an important test during the Grand-Bornand World Cup stage, as they prepare for the Milan-Cortina Olympic Games, to be held from February 6 to 22, 2026.

title: From a best-seller, director Paul Feig turns 'The Housemaid' into a run-of-the-mill film
subhead: The American filmmaker delivers a flat, illustrative adaptation of Freida McFadden's hit novel.

title: Anthropologist Anton Serdeczny: 'The magic of Christmas is a time when the worlds of the living and the dead open up to one another'
subhead: In a fascinating investigation into the Yule log, the historian developed an innovative approach to the magical dimension that has been attributed for millennia to the night of December 24, which he revisited in an interview with Le Monde.

White, snowy Christmas: The truth behind a misleading cliché
subhead: Long associated with imagery of the Three Wise Men, the depiction of Christmas took on a wintry turn in the 16th century. Yet the chances of seeing snow in France on December 25 have never been lower.

title: 2025 was the year AI-generated videos flooded social media
subhead: The endless streams of millions of videos generated by artificial intelligence on Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, X, Facebook and beyond have become inescapable. And users want more.

title: Semiconductors: Nvidia at the heart of the new Pacific battle
subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (1/5):  Whether it's AI, electronics or defense, the 'silicon economy' drives the entire industrial and service sectors. It is at the heart of a fierce battle between global powers, with China seeking to free itself from dependence on US technologies.
